questions.text: You're given a blank canvas. What's your first thought?

answers.text: An opportunity to explore without rules
A surface to create a masterpiece
A tool to practice technical drawing

questions.text: Look at this image of a quiet mountain stream. What stands out most to you?

answers.text: The peacefulness and natural flow
The shapes and textures of the rocks
How the environment could be mapped in 3D

questions.text: What is the next number in the sequence: 2, 4, 8, 16, __?
You are told to solve a problem with no rules or tools. What do you do first?

answers.text: Break down what a 'solution' really means
Start brainstorming ideas without limitation
Ask for clarification or structure

questions.text: What emotion does this abstract painting evoke most?

answers.text: Curiosity, like something's hidden
Anxiety or a feeling of chaos
Nothing really, just colors and lines

questions.text: What is a solution to the equation x^2 / 36 = 25?
You find a broken clock. What do you think it represents?

answers.text: Time is broken and unpredictable
A moment frozen in time
Just a broken object, nothing more

questions.text: A sculpture uses jagged, twisted metal to represent time. What interpretation feels most natural to you?

answers.text: Time is chaotic and unpredictable
Time is harsh, painful, and unpredictable
It captures the complexity of aging
It’s just artistic flair, no deeper meaning

questions.text: If a train leaves Point A at 60mph and another leaves Point B at 45mph, 120 miles apart, when do they meet?

answers.text: 2.09 hours
2 hours
1.2 hours
1.09 hours

questions.text: You're asked to create a new language. What guides your first decisions?

answers.text: How sounds feel when spoken
What cultural stories it might carry
How consistent and learnable it is

questions.text: You hear a child humming to themselves in a hallway. What do you feel?

answers.text: A sense of innocence and wonder
A sense of nostalgia or memory
Curiosity about what they’re imagining
Neutral — just ambient sound

questions.text: Which of the following best describes a prime number?

answers.text: A number only divisible by 1 and itself
A number that repeats in patterns
A number greater than 10 with no factors

questions.text: A door appears in the middle of a field. What do you do?

answers.text: Open it without hesitation
Look for clues about why it’s there
Check if it’s part of a hidden mechanism

questions.text: This photo shows a lone figure walking through fog. What does it express?

answers.text: Isolation, yet peace
Uncertainty about the future
Nothing — just someone walking

questions.text: You're managing a network of 5 computers. One crashes. What’s your instinct?

answers.text: Check logs and identify failure point
Replace the faulty unit and monitor
Reconsider how the system is designed

questions.text: You see a child drawing a house. What do you think they’re expressing?

answers.text: A desire for safety and comfort
A simple representation of home
Just a fun activity with no meaning

questions.text: A clock shows 3:15. What does it make you think of?

answers.text: Time passing, moments lost
A specific time for an event
Just numbers and hands moving

questions.text: You find a puzzle piece that doesn’t fit anywhere. What do you feel?

answers.text: Disappointment at the lack of fit
Frustration at the lack of order
Curiosity about its origin
Acceptance that not everything fits

questions.text: You see a child playing with blocks. What do you think they’re learning?

answers.text: Spatial awareness and balance
Creativity in building and design
Just having fun with no deeper meaning

questions.text: A painting shows a stormy sea. What does it evoke for you?

answers.text: The unpredictability of nature
Chaos and unpredictability of life
The beauty of nature's power
Just colors and shapes without meaning

questions.text: You wake up in a world with no known rules. What’s your first move?

answers.text: Explore until something makes sense
Create your own meaning or system
Wait for structure to appear

questions.text: You see a pattern of lights blinking randomly. What do you assume?

answers.text: There’s a message hidden inside
It’s expressing something emotional
It’s just random blinking

questions.text: You’re asked to imagine a world where gravity flows sideways. What’s most important?

answers.text: The creative potential of such a world
How life and ecosystems would adapt
The physical consequences and math

questions.text: You hear music from a distant room. What do you feel?

answers.text: A story forming in your mind
A sudden wave of emotion
Mild curiosity about the source

questions.text: This image shows an abandoned building. What comes to mind?

answers.text: A lost story waiting to be uncovered
A place echoing with emotion
A structure falling apart

questions.text: A person stares silently out a train window. What does it mean to you?

answers.text: They’re lost in memory or thought
They’re emotionally detached
They’re just looking at scenery

questions.text: What’s the result of (3 × 5) + (4 × 2)?
You’re designing a system with limited energy. What matters most?

answers.text: Efficiency and stability
The system’s adaptability
The symbolic potential of the design

questions.text: You see a machine with gears turning at odd intervals. What do you think?

answers.text: Something is out of sync mechanically
It’s metaphorical — like time distortion
It's part of a surreal narrative

questions.text: What does a spiral staircase represent to you?

answers.text: An endless climb with no final answer
A metaphor for personal growth
A space-efficient architectural choice

questions.text: You’re shown a symbol you’ve never seen. What do you assume?

answers.text: It holds a hidden or ancient meaning
It could represent emotion or feeling
It’s just a random shape

questions.text: You are told that gravity is slowly changing. What’s your thought?

answers.text: Reality is shifting — and so must we
That would create poetic forms of movement
Need to recalculate physics models

questions.text: You see a door labeled 'Do Not Enter'. What do you do?

answers.text: Open it out of curiosity
Imagine what lies behind it
Respect the rule and walk past

questions.text: You read a poem that makes no logical sense. What’s your reaction?

answers.text: Feelings before structure — that’s beautiful
Try to interpret the emotional message
It’s meaningless without clarity

questions.text: A person refuses to speak but draws constantly. What do you understand?

answers.text: They’re speaking in the only way they can
They’re channeling something deep within
They’re avoiding verbal communication

questions.text: This image shows a wilted flower under sunlight. What do you feel?

answers.text: Sadness — beauty is fading
Hope — life once bloomed here
Heat stress and biological decay

questions.text: What is the value of (12 / 3) × (2 + 1)?
You must allocate 100 units of power across 4 systems. What’s your method?

answers.text: Assess needs and distribute proportionally
Balance all equally for stability
Focus on the most important first

questions.text: You're given a sequence: A, C, F, J... What’s next?

answers.text: O
N
P

questions.text: A mirror cracks in front of you. What does it represent?

answers.text: A fractured sense of identity
A symbol of change or awakening
Just broken glass, no deeper meaning

questions.text: You’re shown a perfect circle in an empty room. What is it to you?

answers.text: An infinite cycle
A peaceful visual metaphor
A geometric shape with symmetry

questions.text: Artificially delivering biomolecules to plant cells is important, but hard to do through the plant cell wall. What's the best way forward?

answers.text: Overcome the barrier with nanotube technology
Neglect the issue and change the crop
Conceptualize a new plant model

questions.text: Rydra Wong, the protagonist of *Babel-17*, is a poet. In Delany’s novels, poets are common. What does this say to you?

answers.text: Poets reflect the author’s view of communication
It’s a narrative trope reused too often
Poets aren’t typical but they hold symbolic roles

questions.text: Francis Cecil Sumner founded a psychology department to help Black students. What role did he serve?

answers.text: A strong advocate for equitable access
A well-known psychologist but not impactful
A minor figure remembered mostly for the school

questions.text: A poet writes: 'Why, beautiful still finger, are you black? And why are you pointing upwards?' What does this evoke for you?

answers.text: Awe and wonder at the contrast in nature
Symbolic tension between beauty and mortality
Just figurative language with no deeper meaning

questions.text: Which interpretation best supports the idea that panel discussions are more informative than debates?

answers.text: Panels allow for more diverse perspectives
Debates often lead to emotional arguments
Panels are less structured and more chaotic
Debates are more entertaining than informative

questions.text: Some bird species lay their eggs in the nests of other birds. What does this behavior suggest?

answers.text: An evolutionary strategy to offload parenting
A symbolic gesture of trust between species
Just a strange habit with no pattern

questions.text: A researcher observes that soil with fungi grows better plants than sterilized soil. What does this indicate?

answers.text: Mycorrhizal fungi improve nutrient absorption
Fungi emotionally support the plants
The difference is probably coincidence

questions.text: When a scientist finds the same genetic markers in two populations separated by centuries, what does that imply?

answers.text: There was migration or transfer between them
The similarity is spiritual or symbolic
They must have always lived together

questions.text: A short story describes a girl pulling weeds with joy. What does this imply about her?

answers.text: She finds comfort and purpose in care
She sees the garden as a metaphor for healing
She is completing a task she was told to do

questions.text: A poet compares the mind to a flower needing rain. What does this metaphor suggest?

answers.text: The mind flourishes with nourishment
The mind decays when logic is absent
All comparisons are inherently flawed

questions.text: A young dog avoids strangers but loves its owner. What emotional response fits this pattern?

answers.text: The dog has formed a deep, selective bond
The dog views others as threats to its leader
The dog is just obeying conditioning

questions.text: A scientist finds that sugar in bear diets shortens hibernation. What conclusion is supported?

answers.text: Human foods can biologically alter animal cycles
Sugar is symbolic of modern disruption
Correlation does not imply causation

questions.text: A study shows cats are surprised when voices play from two locations. What does this tell us?

answers.text: Cats map spatial presence from audio cues
Cats feel emotions like betrayal
Speakers confuse animal hearing systems

questions.text: A character closes her eyes and winces at a bouquet of flowers. What might this reveal?

answers.text: The flowers trigger discomfort or grief
She rejects symbols of beauty and tradition
She’s sensitive to pollen

questions.text: You see a staircase that leads into the sky. What do you assume?

answers.text: It’s a metaphor for chasing the impossible
A dream symbol about progress
It’s an unsafe and unrealistic structure

questions.text: You wake up and no longer recognize your reflection. What’s your first thought?

answers.text: Reality has shifted — I’m someone new
My identity is fractured or hidden
There must be a logical explanation

questions.text: A city map shows streets rearranging every day. What does this inspire in you?

answers.text: A sense of freedom and creative motion
It reflects chaos within structured systems
That’s inefficient and unsustainable

questions.text: You’re told to invent a new number. What’s your response?

answers.text: Numbers are ideas — I’ll create one with new logic
I’d look for patterns or gaps in existing numbers
You can’t just invent a number

questions.text: You walk into a room with a single red thread stretching across it. What do you feel?

answers.text: It must symbolize fate or connection
Someone was trying to guide attention
It’s just a string, nothing else

questions.text: Someone gives you a box and says 'what’s inside changes depending on who asks.' How do you respond?

answers.text: Reality bends to perception — that’s powerful
That’s a beautiful metaphor for subjectivity
It’s a trick — the contents are static

questions.text: A desert has a single flower growing in the sand. What does it mean to you?

answers.text: Life insists on expressing itself
Hope against overwhelming odds
It’s just a plant in harsh conditions

questions.text: If you had no name, what would your mind become?

answers.text: Free — I’d redefine myself constantly
Lost — identity is part of self
Unchanged — a name doesn’t alter who I am

questions.text: A machine can write poems but never feel. What does this say about intelligence?

answers.text: Emotion is the missing piece of true thinking
Poetry doesn’t require emotion, just pattern
Machines can’t truly understand what they create

questions.text: You see a tree growing upside down. What’s your reaction?

answers.text: That’s beautiful — it defies nature’s limits
I’d want to learn how it grew that way
I’d assume something’s wrong with the soil
